newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS TUESDAY MIXED AGAINST UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS TUESDAY MIXED AGAINST UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar ended Tuesday's interbank session weaker against the U.S. dollar and the rand but was quoted firmer on European currencies, foreign exchange dealers said.
"There were quite a few buyers today -- I want to believe there was a payment going out. We saw some big monies coming in but I believe they were all absorbed by the payments," a dealer commented.

He said the local currency finished the day a cent easier on the U.S. dollar at 10.9150/9300 after closing at 10.9050/9200 the previous day and was also quoted softer against South Africa's rand at 2.3894/3943 compared to 2.3780/3830.
However, it closed firmer against pound sterling at 17.5370/5473 from 17.6800/7180 and was at 6.5944/6050 against the mark, up from late Monday's 6.6560/6700.
